summary: This document is a sign-in log for a suicide prevention training course conducted for staff at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center on December 7, 2018. The training objectives focus on identifying and managing suicide risk among inmates in locked units and single cells, particularly for high-risk groups.

events.title: Suicide Prevention Training at MCC New York
events.description: A suicide prevention/SHU training course was conducted for staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The training covered suicide risk associated with locked units and single cells, identification of high-risk inmate groups, management strategies, and emergency response procedures.

keyFacts: A suicide prevention training session was held for staff at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center on December 7, 2018.
The training specifically addressed suicide risk in locked units and single cells, indicating these were areas of concern.
High-risk inmate groups identified included the mentally ill, behavior disordered inmates, sex offenders, and high-custody inmates.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting it relates to procedures or staff training at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The training log includes space for 20 participants to sign, but no individual names are listed in the provided text.
